abstract: Metropolitan Museum of Art announces layoffs that will, along with previously announced hiring freeze and voluntary buyouts, bring total job cuts to at least 100; move is part of effort to reduce ballooning deficit and comes at time when some are already questioning museum’s direction.
lead_paragraph: Just three months after announcing a hiring freeze and voluntary buyouts, the Metropolitan Museum of Art is turning to layoffs in core areas.

headline.main: Met Job Cuts Could Exceed 100 in a Move to Steady Finances
headline.print_headline: Met Job Cuts Could Top 100 in Core Areas
